Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2010 07:16PM sproutdr wrote: first breast MRI...done like a trooper! lol not so bad was over in about 30 min..will have results in a day or two... no worries all will be well... I had bloodwork done too and go to my Onc on Friday...then I'm having a colossal MARTINI w/20 olives ... thank you for all the encouragement, thoughts and prayers...I felt the angels all around today
Posts.Title: Breast MRI sproutdr Lisa1962

Posts.Content: sproutdr wrote: going for first Breast MRI June 7th .. I am 9 years post BC(age 40 now yay!) and was just looking for some support, stories, a hug :)  I have changed my follow up regimine (discussed w/ my oncologist) that I will be doing the MRI once a year & bloodwork... Would really appreciate any feedback..thanks so much Liz Morrison Dx 12/2001, IDC, 2cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/0 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast MRI sproutdr Lisa1962

Posts.Content: May 10, 2010 12:04PM sproutdr wrote: Hi Christine! I def appreciate your positive thoughts coming my way in June  That's a great suggestion and funny too b/c sometimes i get really sleepy when I go for tests...either the lack of sleep or anxiety knocks me out!! lol Be well !!
Posts.Title: Breast MRI sproutdr Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2010 08:51AM sproutdr wrote: Ok ladies...drumroll............just got my phone call and the results are A OK!!!!!!!!!!!! Thank you all for your love, support, and prayers and getting me through my first MRI...I def felt the angels all around me yesterday and today, and I have your positive vibes to thank for that... I wish you all days of health, serenity and happiness...after all, we are worth it XOXOXOXOX PS Is it too early to go get an ice cream?  NAHHHHHHHHHH lol
Posts.Title: Breast MRI sproutdr Lisa1962

Posts.Content: May 24, 2010 06:55PM sproutdr wrote: Hi ladies! ok question?  When is the best time in your cycle to go for breast MRI? I have mine scheduled for June 7th which would be day 15...I read that u shld go btween day 5-15, but also read that day 11-15 estrogen is high :/  I'm a lil confused and well of course NERVOUS as it is getting closer AND I was thinking of resceduling to day 9 or 10... OMG can you say freak out... It's my first MRI and just would like ur opinions on this one...maybe I shld stop reading and as NIKE says "JUST DO IT!" lol  I had my period until 31, went thru chemical menopause with BC, then after tamoxifen and lupron for 5 yrs...well mother nature came a knocking again at 37 & I guess I'm feeling anxious getting my follow up check ups n scans w/ estrogen running around again over the past 3 yrs... yay periods! LOL thanks for listening Liz aka Sproutdr
Posts.Title: Breast MRI sproutdr Lisa1962

Posts.Content: May 4, 2010 09:02PM sproutdr wrote: Hi Jennifer!! and a big (((((((((thanks)))))))))) I was diagnosed at 31 yr old w/ 2cm ductal carcinoma...er+/pr+, HER2-  no node involvement.... lumpectomy, had 4 rounds doxil chemo, radiation , and 5yrs tamoxifen & lupron shots ...  I just turned 40  and received my PhD in Holistic Nutrition in October...  even though it's 9 years(YAY!!) , well everytime a scan comes up...the nerves still come out...thanks for sharing your MRI experience w/ me and yes, continued good health is a non negotiable for all of us ladies...
Posts.Title: Breast MRI sproutdr Lisa1962

Posts.Content: May 13, 2010 10:21PM sproutdr wrote: YAY!!! Excellent news Sheri!!! Go out and celebrate!! You can't see me, but I really am doing my happy dance 4U lol Many sunny n healthy days ahead  Liz
